text: A small waterfall feeds a secluded swimming hole among th Redwoods. Peaceful. Serene. We move over the rocks near the water’s edge until... we come across a thatch of matted, bloody hair. A LIFELESS BODY rests in shallow water near the shore. BLOOD trickles over a WOMAN’S HAND -- a pale strip of ski where her wedding band once rested. cur TO BLACK:
We snap out of the darkness into a new day. A beautiful mountain town in the hills above Santa Cruz.
ECU - A brand new running shoe. Youthful FEMALE HANDS ent frame and SNAP the laces tight. cU - A STARTER GUN FIRES. cur TO:

SIX ATHLETIC HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS in the middle of a sprint. KELLIE CALDWELL (17) -- confident, smart and centered bey her years -- quickly pulls ahead of four of the girls. Almost at the front... she trails the WINNER by a hair. SWISH. The winner breaks through the ribbon. Kellie in c succession. APPLAUSE from the stands. Kellie briefly winces at her loss -- then smiles and wave to the crowd. cur TO:

Time for a picture. Kellie holds a SECOND PLACE MEDAL aloft and wraps an arm around JAMES CALDWELL (early 40’s) -- her handsome, proud father. Posed at their feet is little sister ABBY (8) -- almost t shy to smile. A moment with the happy family... SNAP! TODD (17) -- athletic and kind -- is kept to the sideline Forever stuck in the friend zone. Kellie approaches him and he attempts to hug her. She inadvertently RECOILS but saves the moment with a smile.

(nervous laugh) Come on, I’m all sweaty. She glances at her family to make sure they didn’t see. INT./EXT. JAMES’ CAR - NIGHT Kellie and Abby eat celebratory ice cream as James naviga the winding road. James pulls to a stop at a deserted RED LIGHT.
You killed it out there.
I guess. It'd be nice to win at some point...
You got a trophy, didn't you?
So did two other girls.
Well, I'm allowed to be proud of you.
Are you proud of me too?
Of course I am.
For what?
For bucking the trend.
What does that mean?
It means that I'm proud of how unique you are. You're going to grow up to be something special.
(lightly teasing) Our special snowflake.
They pull into the driveway of a nice, semi-secluded hous in the hills.
James and the girls are in bed -- Abby in the middle -- t comforter pulled up around them. He grabs the Apple remote.
What'1ll it be?
It's your turn.
You're the big winner. You decide.
You never choose. You should get some say around here at some point.
(re: Abby) Frozen?
If that's how you want to spend your turn. You'll both be asleep so quick it won't matter.
That, my young lady, is BS. cur TO:
James and Abby are fast asleep. The TV illuminates the ro

Kellie rinses dishes -- part of her routine -- and places them in the drying rack. Her eyes linger on the soapy water... bubbles swirl acros the surface... We PUSH IN on her face... lost in thought... We see the sink get perilously full then OVERFLOW. Water starts to pool at her feet. She snaps out of it, shuts the sink off and grabs a rag.
She covers James with the blanket, picks Abby up and carr her out of the room.
BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! The motion sensors go off as Kellie carries Abby through the room.
(quietly) Yeah, yeah.

Kellie tucks Abby in. It's SHIVERING COLD. She tries to shut the window over th bed -- but it's stuck. She PUSHES harder... it comes loose. Almost slamming shut before Kellie catches it again... Kellie glances down at Abby. Thankfully still asleep. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie carefully hangs her newest prize on the large TROP SHELF that hangs over her bed. Winning trophies, medals and ribbons from throughout the years are arranged chronologically from left to right. All of them are SECOND or THIRD PLACE. Except for the ver first one -- World's Best Daughter. She gets in bed and pulls up the covers. Satisfied. As soon as she shuts her eyes -- WHISPERS from another ro
Kellie enters to find Abby standing in a corner of the room -- whispering at the wall.
What are you doing?
Talking...
Aren't you a little old for imaginary friends? She walks over to Abby, places her hands on her shoulders and steers her back to bed.
But I'm not tired anymore. Abby lays in bed, letting Kellie pull the covers over her
What do you mean? You're not scared, are you?
No.
So why can't you go back to sleep?
Because.

Well, count some sheep or something, alright? It'll make my job easier. Kellie playfully pinches her cheek and gets up to leave. As she reaches the door she glances back at Abby... somew unsettled by all of this.
Eggs in a pan. Bacon sizzling. Toast POPS out of a toaste Kellie cooks breakfast for three. Been doing it for years Abby shuffles in wearing COWGIRL BOOTS over her tights.
Nope, inappropriate.
Why?
Just one of those society things, sis. Go change. James -- wearing a bathrobe -- passes by Abby as he heads the fridge.
(to Kellie) Need any help?
You don't have time to help. Get dressed. James looks down at his bathrobe and nods -- ‘you're rig He gives her a quick kiss on the forehead.
What would I do without you? James turns and heads back to his room -- leaving Kellie beam with pride over her successful morning routine.
Kellie and Abby eat breakfast. Playful. Not a care in the world. James, now dressed, sits between them. Nervous about something -- he takes a deep breath.
What is it?
Nothing... I just... I think it's time we talk about --
Oh no.
What is it?
Not what. Who. Her. (to James) When?
Next week.
I like her.
Look, I just want you to be happy.
Me too.
But can I just say one thing? And it's about what's right for you, so you can't get mad.
I reserve the right to get mad, but go ahead.
I'd rather see you with someone... else.
And now I am a little mad.
Why?
Because you don't get a vote now. You get a vote at the beginning, between our third and fourth date. Not a year and a half later.
I'm sorry I just...
I've played more than fair. I haven't had her over for sleepovers
-- that you know of.
Way TMI.

And now I want her in my life. Our lives, actually. You could use some help around here. You can just be seventeen. Real seventeen, not superhero seventeen. Kellie leans back in her chair, annoyed. This is a battle she cannot win.
I like superhero seventeen. cur TO:
The patio of a laid back gastropub. James sits across fro ROBIN (29) -- warm, sunny and ever so slightly "off."
Are you kidding? The girls love you.
He smiles Really? I just get this feeling...
Look, it's a shake-up. But I know it'll be a good one.
I don't want them to associate me with disruption.
Sometimes disruption is good. I need disruption.
I know. But I remember that age. Seventeen? She'll have an opinion.
Are you having second thoughts? Because the moving deposit's --
No! No. I wanna make it work either way. I'm just thinking out loud. I think I could be a good friend to them, you know? (beat) And a good partner to you.
Wow. and takes her hand. JAMES (cont'd) What a toxic presence you'll be.

TIGHT on Robin. She stands in front of a mirror -- steeli herself for something.  10. A CRAMPED SPACE containing lots of new-age CERAMIC SCULPTURES and the EQUIPMENT to make them. It looks like we're in her apartment... She braces herself in front of the mirror and takes a cal reassuring breath.
You can do this. She takes a few steps towards the exit...
... and steps outside. Revealing the UHAUL in the drivewa

Kellie and Abby sit on the floor -- taking in the progres The family CAT sits between them. The SCULPTURES stick out like a sore thumb in their new environment. Robin kneels down to Kellie and Abby’s eyeline.
I just want to thank you girls for letting me into your home and your hearts. You know I love your dad and I’m looking forward to being your --
Mom?
Sister?
I could be a bit of both. A Momster.
Now that has a ring to it.
You're right. We’ll just vibe it out. Abby notices James removing a single PICTURE from the wal He places it in a box and heads to his room. She follows.  11.
James removes a couple of photos from his dresser and add them to the box. Behind him -- an ELECTRICIAN installs a custom CHANDELIER above the bed. Ceramic and glass. Sculpted by Robin.
What are you doing?
It’s a new start, right?
She doesn’t know you were married?

Of course she does. It’s about making her feel at home. And it’s a new start for me too. Abby pries one of the pictures away from him. Their family as it was five years ago -- James, Kellie (t 12), Abby (then 3) and LEXY (early 30’s). Lexy was luminous. Big eyes that could find a lie anywher
I don’t remember her.

Well, there won’t be a test. You were three. James kneels down next to her and looks at the picture. JAMES (cont'd) She loved you very much. (thinks ) We can put this in your room if you want. Would you like that? Abby smiles and nods. Robin enters -- surprised by the chandelier.
Wow. It's up already?
Yep.  12.
Are you sure it... fits?
(lying) Yep.
Kellie roams among the boxes and knick-knacks infecting h house. There’s definitely some annoyance simmering up.

Robin is unpacking DOZENS OF BOOKS and placing them on th shelves. New age stuff. Some YA fiction. Some poetry and eastern religion selections sprinkled in. Kellie reaches for one called ‘The Replacement Mother: Ho Not To Be a Wicked Stepmom.'
Good stuff. You make it all the way through this one? Robin -- simultaneously gentle and firm -- removes the bo from Kellie’s hands. She knows when she’s being made fun
Can't blame me for trying.
(backpedaling) Well you know Abby's kind of weird. If you need any help, you can just ask me. There's no book for her. Robin smiles.
Thanks. That would be great.
James -- draped in a bloody apron -- opens up the grill a inspects a delicious looking tri-tip. A bottle of LIGHTER FLUID at his side.  13.
Robin plates the food as Abby sits in her chair giggling talking to... no one.
(girlish and formal) You'll have to wait. It’s dinner time. Kellie throws a look at Robin -- 'see what I mean?'
When did this start?
Just the other day. (to Abby) Abs. What's the deal?
I guess imaginary friends can be healthy.
Not as healthy as real ones.
Meh, let her explore.
I'm sorry did you just say "meh?" Like, phonetically?
Is that not how you do it?
No, momster. Internet only. You sure you're only twenty-nine?
Just different interests I guess. Robin's smile fades a bit -- Kellie decides to ease up a little.
Good for you. I'd love to unplug. (beat) Plus it's probably just the generation gap.  14.
BLOOD oozes out as James carves the tri-tip.
The “new” Caldwell family settles in for dinner. Kellie a Abby prepare to dig into their steak. Robin swoops in and sprinkles a bunch of SEEDS on their m right before their forks make contact.
Sesame seeds?
Hemp seeds.
So what, am I going to be stoned all night?
Of course not.
I run track. They test, you know.
It won’t show up. (reconsiders) And if it did it’s not like weed ever made anyone faster.
It’s okay, Kellie.
Its got Omega 3’s. Your dad loves it.
Load me up. Robin sprinkles seeds on his steak as he glares at Kellie ‘give her a break.’
Actually it just adds a little extra crunch. I like it.
Your brain likes it too.  15. James sets his fork down and raises a glass of wine.

I'd just like to take this opportunity to welcome Robin into our home... (looks into Robin's eyes) «+. and into our family. Everyone CLINKS their glasses. Kellie and Robin exchange nervous looks as they move their glasses in for a toast.. SMASH. Robin's glass shatters in her hand. Everyone at th table startles. JAMES (cont'd) Jesus!
Ouch. Blood drips from Robin's hand.
Are you okay? Robin gets up, heads to the sink and washes off the wound

Yeah, can you just grab me a paper towel? Kellie grabs a roll of paper towels and heads over to Rob BLOOD trickles down Robin's finger into the water in the sink. Oddly similar to the image in the opening scene.
Yikes. Robin rinses the wound. It's tiny. Kellie presses the pap towel into Robin's palm.
Kellie flosses and brushes her teeth. All of her movement controlled and efficient. Almost comically precise. A NOISE from inside her room. She turns her head...  16.
Kellie steps from her bathroom into the bedroom. WHOOSH. The window opens. She JUMPS back and lets out a gasp. Todd pokes his head through.
Jesus Christ, you scared me. (catches her breath) You can't be here right now.
Why not?
My Dad's here. Todd finishes climbing through the window.
He's never here on Tuesdays.
Well, now she's here and that's changed. On Todd -- 'Bummer.'
That sucks.

Didn't you see the cars? Todd moves towards her... aiming for seductive, only achieving awkward. She allows a laugh. He leans in for a kiss but she pulls away. KELLIE (cont'd) We’ve talked about this.
Come on, we’ve been dancing around it forever. You know we’re more than friends.
How’s that?  17.
I can tell by the way you look at me. He leans in again. TODD (cont'd) They won’t hear anything. They’re probably going at it right now.
And you think we should do it in sync with them? Ew. She gently pushes him away. KELLIE (cont'd) I don’t want to think of him that way.
You mean with another woman?
What?!
Instead of your mom.
No. No one wants to think about their dad doing anything.
James and Robin are in fact not going at it. His advances have been thwarted by some worrying on Robin's part. A breeze blows in through the open window.
The seeds were stupid. I should have asked before putting them on.
It's not a big deal. She liked them.

Yeah, but it's my first night here and I'm messing with her food. Not good.  18. She shakes her head, lost in the past. ROBIN (cont'd) I was never cool in school. Whenever I tried they just hated me more. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Abby's half asleep. The window by her bed is once again open -- allowing a gentle breeze into the room. She shivers a bit. Pulls the blanket tighter. Her feet ar still exposed. BRRR. Abby's sheet LIFTS up. At first we think it’s the billowi wind... until it’s PULLED down to cover her feet. A quiet beat. The open window SLAMS shut and the sheets pull TIGHT arou Abby -- literally imprisoning her on the bed. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Todd and Kellie hear Abby SCREAM! She heads for the door. Todd follows.
James and Robin exchange looks and jump out of bed. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Kellie and Todd run into Abby’s room. Abby’s curled up in ball on the bed.
What happened? James enters the room -- worried.

Robin second guesses if she should go into Abby's room or not -- 'I don't want to overstep my bounds.' She sees something MOVING out of the corner of her eye.  19. She turns her head. ‘What's that?' She looks over to Kellie's room... the door is open... a single trophy falls from Kellie's shelf to the ground. She takes a step towards it... but Abby's crying grows louder. She takes a deep breath and heads into Abby's bedroom.
Robin enters and takes her place by James' side. Todd lurks in the background -- almost hoping James won't notice him.
Someone slammed the window!

Sweetie, no one slammed it. James lifts the window. It’s loose. Slides down too easil JAMES (cont'd) It fell. Kellie takes a step towards Abby but Robin beats her to it -- she watches as the new addition comforts her sister JAMES (cont'd) I'll fix it later. It’s too cold to be open anyway. Robin pulls the sheet back onto Abby's bed. James turns and locks eyes with Todd. JAMES (cont'd) And what's he doing here?
Getting me grounded?
Kellie ushers Todd out front. They shiver in the night ai
I don’t know what I was thinking. I just wanted to help.  20.
Your heart was in the right place. Just not your head.
You really going to be grounded?
Please. He’s wrapped around my finger.
Pretty soon he'll be wrapped around your stepmom's. He pats her on the shoulder and heads to his car.
(calling out) She’s not my stepmom!
Not yet. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie enters... Abby is nowhere to be seen. WHISPERS from the closet. Kellie opens the door to find A inside. Abby looks up at her.
I'm not scared anymore.
Good. Yeah, it was just a loud noise. She takes hold of Abby's hand and gently pulls her up and out of the closet. KELLIE (cont'd) You've really gotta cut that out. She guides Abby back into bed.
I'm not tired.
I've heard that before. (MORE)

KELLIE (cont'd) (sighs) I can lay here for a bit if you want. Kellie crawls into bed with Abby. She notices the family photo on her bedside table. KELLIE (cont'd) Dad give you that? A beat while Abby considers her next thought.
Why doesn’t daddy talk about how she died?

Well, it’s not fun to talk about. And mommy wasn’t... it wasn’t a good time for daddy and mommy. (switches gears) All you need to know is that she was amazing and she loved you. (beat) Lay on your front and I’1l show you how she used to put me to sleep. Abby lays on her stomach. Kellie places two fingers at th small of her back and gently walks them up her spine. KELLIE (cont'd) (singing) The itsy-bitsy spider went up the water spout... She quickly trails her fingers away from Abby’s neck. KELLIE (cont'd) (singing) Down came the rain and washed the spider out. Out came the sun and dried up all the rain. She walks her fingers back up. KELLIE (cont'd) And the itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the spout again.
Again.  22.
If you’re anything like I was this'll take a while. (sings) The itsy-bitsy spider went up the water spout... We pan over from the bed to Abby's door... slightly open. EYE watches them from outside.
Robin -- in her nightgown -- watches from the darkness of the hallway. Maybe jealous... maybe just wanting to know how to take c of Abby... After a beat she turns and heads back to her bedroom.
Robin soaks in the tub -- a candle lit on the edge of the basin -- trying to unwind. A KNOCK on the door. She startles.
Everything okay in there?

Yep! Just trying to unwind. (to herself) And hoping this gets easier. TAP. A water drop falls from the shower head above and lands o her forehead. TAP. Robin glances up at the shower head -- annoyed. Another water drop forms then... TAP. The candle FLICKERS as though wind blows over it. Robin looks around... all the windows are closed. TAP. TAP. Robin looks over to THE SINK -- which is now dripping. 'Weird.'  23. She gets out of the tub, puts on her bathrobe and heads t the sink. She twists the faucet OFF. TAP. A DROP of water strikes her forehead. She looks up.. .».. and sees a THIN LINE OF WATER stretching across the ceiling from the shower -- stopping right over her head. TAP. She grabs a towel and blots the water from the ceiling. She looks to the candle... which flickers again before go out completely.

Egg whites and spinach in a pan. Turkey bacon in the microwave. Spelt toast POPS out of the toaster. A healthier, more hippy-ish version of the breakfast we s earlier. Kellie practically skips in only to stop in her tracks as she discovers Robin has taken over her duties.
Breakfast?
You know, you don't have to do this. I normally get it. Part of my routine.
Oh no, you've got school. You probably have to cram for tests or whatever. It'll be my routine.
I really think Abby's used to -- Abby -- happily munching away -- looks up from her plate.

This is good! Kellie sighs, grabs a plate and takes her seat. DING! A laptop on the table chimes. Robin runs over to it and clasps her hands excitedly.  24. ONSCREEN -- Robin’s Etsy page. Her sculptures actually se like crazy.
Sold another one!
Of those things? Kellie stifles a laugh.
(whispers to Abby) Be nice. Robin grabs a plate of food and joins them at the table.
(to Abby) You get back to sleep okay after your little adventure?
Yeah. The window didn't fall like dad said, though.
Oh no?
I was cold so she shut it.
Who shut it?
I don't think --
I think it was Mom. The air is sucked out of the room.
Abby, it wasn't Mom okay? Mom's not here anymore.

Oh, I’m sure she’s here in some way. Robin reaches out with both arms, grabs Kellie and Abby b the hands, and closes her eyes.  25. ROBIN (cont'd) (like she's acknowledging a presence) Lexy, it’s an honor to be in your home with your two beautiful girls. Kellie pulls her hands away.
Are you trying to talk to a ghost? Because ghosts are scary. Even if they're Mom. (to Abby) Which it's not.
Of course not. I was thinking more along the lines of a therapeutic --
Not talking to walls is therapeutic.
(to Abby) What makes you think it's her? Why now?
She’s always been here. I just wasn’t looking for her. sharp in his suit.
See? Now it's in her head. James enters the kitchen -- already dressed and looking
(to Robin)

obscuring Will you look at this? I'm running on time for once. -- James gives Robin a quick kiss on the forehead, Kellie's face from the frame as he does so. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - MORNING Kellie’s SKIPPING ROPE. Always training. James KNOCKS on side of her open door.
Hey kiddo.  26.
Hey pops.
Listen, I need you to do me a solid.
What’s that?
How would you feel about integrating Robin a little more?
She’s been here 24 hours and I’m two for two on meals.

I just want her to feel welcome, you know? He gestures to one of Robin's sculptures in the hallway - still wrapped in plastic from the move. JAMES (cont'd) And you could stand to do a little decorating. Her face drops.
Did she ask you to do this?
No. And it'll play a lot better if it's your idea.
Kellie, Abby and James man a table in the front yard. Box and knick-knacks litter the table. An old VCR, a sculptur of Robin's, a pair of old Rollerblades. No customers so far...
Why are we selling our stuff?  27.
Well, it's not just our stuff. It's her stuff too. We're both getting rid of what we don't need so everything fits together.
(rolls her eyes) Yeah, her stuff meshes. A car pulls up. KELLIE (cont'd) I didn't know Grandpa was coming.
I don't want to get rid of anything he'd want. The car door opens and BERNARD (65) -- a swaggering, port curmudgeon -- steps outside.
Hey there... fam.
Hi, Bernard. Hi, Bernard.
Hi, Grandpa! Bernard bends down and gives Abby a hug.
How's my favorite grandkid? (winks up at Kellie) Just kidding, it's a tie. Robin emerges carrying a big box -- she heads over to the table and sets it down.
Hi! I'm Robin! James stands up -- flustered.
Hey there, I'm Bernard.
I can't believe you guys haven't met. Robin, Bernard's my father in law.  28. Robin does the math in her head -- 'oh.'

It's okay, darlin'. Life goes on. Nice to meet you. Bernard goes off to play with Abby while Robin starts unpacking the box. She pulls out a few DVD's and some books. Then -- she slo pulls out an OLD NECKLACE -- somehow both ornate and tasteful. Robin looks at it curiously. Kellie's eyes widen with ang
What are you doing? We can't sell that!
Oh, I'm sorry. It didn't seem like your style. Kellie takes the necklace from her.
This was my Mom's.
Oh, Kellie. You know I would never --
Everyone simmer down. Bernard wheezes a bit... pulls out an INHALER and takes a puff as he heads over to take a look. BERNARD (cont'd) I don’t remember that one.
Turquoise is a healing stone. (beat) It also keeps people from overreacting.
Why don't you put it on?
Oh no, I don't think --  29.
Come on. If you want it you should wear it. Kellie carefully drapes the necklace over her head... it rests perfectly around her neck.

It looks beautiful on you, Kellie. Robin hands the box she took the necklace from over to Kellie. ROBIN (cont'd) You should really be the one to go through this. Bernard pats Robin on the back and steers her towards the table full of knick-knacks.
Now let's take a look at the rest of this garbage.
Kellie shuts the door behind her. She quickly pulls off the necklace.... places it in her dresser drawer... and closes it.
A lethargic SCIENCE TEACHER lectures. Kellie sits in fron of all the other STUDENTS.
And what does the law of conservation of energy state? An OVEREAGER STUDENT shoots her hand up. The Science Teac nods in her direction.
That energy can neither be created or destroyed. Kellie just stares ahead. Lost in thought.
Very good. What can energy do under this law?  30. Overeager Student shoots her hand up again.
(blurts out) Change form.

That's correct. (beat) Although we still raise our hands around here. BZZZ. She reaches into her bag and grabs her cell phone. ON PHONE -- 3 MISSED CALLS and VOICEMAILS from ‘Abby School.’ Kellie raises her hand.
I'm sorry, can I be excused?
Kellie pulls into the elementary school parking lot. She jumps out of her car and RUSHES inside.
Hi Kellie, we’re having a bit of a problem with Abby. We were actually wondering if you could come get her?
Kellie approaches a SCHOOL ADMINISTRATOR at her desk.
Hi, you guys called. I'm here to get Abby.
She's not here.
What do you mean?
Her mom picked her up.  31.
Okay, her mom is dead. You know that, right?
(whoops ) I'm so sorry. Not her mom. That pretty young lady. Your father added her to the list. She was upsetting the other kids...
wh , annoyed) Ly?
She told them she... could talk to the dead. The kids got in her face. Made fun of her.
Kellie gets into her car -- whips out her phone and dials ‘Dad.’ It goes to voicemail.
You’ve reached James. I’m over forty, so feel free to leave a message.
(into phone) You gave Robin Mom privileges? Isn’t that a little fast? (beat) At least someone’s still doing your job for you. She angrily hangs up.
Kellie pulls into the driveway.
Robin and Abby walk down the hall towards her room.  32.
You know the kids at my school picked on me too.
They did?
Big time. I was a little bit different like you are.
How? Robin takes a long inhale, smiles and kneels down to her.

Us weird ones, we've got to stick together. (beat) Come on, I've got a surprise for you. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Abby bounds into her room with Robin following. On her be is a WOODEN BOX. She slowly opens it... INSIDE -- PICTURES of Lexy and Abby together. A LOCK OF HAIR.
I found this stuff during the garage sale. I figure if Kellie gets the necklace... I wanted to save something for you.
(holding the box) You made this for me?
I think it’s important for you to feel a connection with her. And to know that I’m here for you, not to take her place.
Kellie quietly sneaks up on Abby's room... peeks through open door.  33.
Abby looks to the closet tentatively... almost as though she's seeking permission from someone we can't see. She nods to whatever she's looking at and then proceeds t give Robin a hug.
Awww. I'm fitting in already? Kellie enters -- her eyes lock on the box.
Is that my mom's stuff?
I thought --
Can you ask before doing things like this please? She's already fixated.
Your dad and I discussed it. Kellie sighs... she'll let this one go. She sits on the b next to Abby.
She can have it. It's just weird to see this stuff again. I miss her.
Of course you do. Kellie pulls the photo out of the box and gazes at it.
She was great. (ill-timed glance at Robin) One of a kind.
James and Robin are post-coital in bed.
What you did for Abby today was really sweet.  34.
I just don't want her to think I'm trying to replace this perfect mom. (almost in tears) I already feel like I'm trying to replace a perfect wife.
Who says you're not perfect?
Part of you has to wish she was still here.

Of course. I loved her very much. But she's not here. You are. And you're not second fiddle. She was my first choice then, but you're my first choice now. (beat) Besides, it's not like things were perfect at the end.
How? James takes a deep breath. ROBIN (cont'd) If you don't want to talk about it --
No, it's okay. She was just distant, you know? Like something was sucking the joy out of her. (beat) I mean, she wasn't wearing her ring when she died.
I'm sorry, James.

It's not all her fault, you know? I could have done a better job. I was checked out, not involved enough with the kids... (beat) So now I just wonder. About everything. He rolls on his side to face her.  35. JAMES (cont'd) Promise me something, okay?
Of course.

Keep me in the loop. Don't let me wonder. INT. KELLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kellie stares at the moon outside her window. Something catches her attention... A HORRIFYING vision in the corner. Moonlight bears down o it like an evil, black tree growing out of the floor. She flicks on the lights... it’s just that sculpture of Robin's.
Great. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Abby lays on her stomach, singing softly to herself.
